intro: Uragoga lubutuensis, commonly known as the Lubutu mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within montane forests. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a velvety texture. Uragoga lubutuensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
